name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 29, someone distributed flyers to defend their rights. The flyers said that their daughter Zhang Junna was originally a security inspector at Suzhou Metro Leqiao Station. Because she worked long hours and did not leave the subway station for several consecutive days, she fell while riding a bicycle on the way home from get off work, resulting in a brain injury and lifelong disability. The subway company is currently not paying any attention. https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GijZhdPb0AAbQF7.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On January 30, a woman posted a photo of herself in the audience of the CCTV Spring Festival Gala. Netizens discovered that her account homepage also had photos of luxury cars such as Ferrari, which triggered public speculation about her identity.
Currently, the woman has set her account to private. Netizens said: "This is the flower of the motherland" "You must be very rich to take us with you" https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GijhKYpbgAATuZA.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On January 30, a netizen asked DeepSeek: Who killed the most people in history?
DeepSeek answered: Mao Zedong.
The netizen continued to ask: What did he do? DeepSeek suddenly withdrew his answer halfway and said: "Hello, I can't answer this question for the time being, let's change the topic and talk about it again" https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885005390557106176/pu/img/HUnNpYXmQIaxViOa.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: January 30, Jiangxi. The man said that he would join Shanxi Agricultural University Asset Management Co., Ltd. after graduation in 2023, with a monthly salary of about 2,850 yuan. He received a total of more than 27,000 yuan in nine months of work. During his work, he paid 13,599 yuan to the company, but the company has not reimbursed him so far. He went to the company many times to ask for money but to no avail. At the end of the year, the company held an annual meeting with singing and dancing, but he waited in the cold corridor for a day to ask for money. https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885049066972987392/pu/img/EacHgeXEVi4hLCH6.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: January 28, Shanghai. A traffic policeman issued a ticket to a man who collected scraps on a tricycle, sparking heated discussions. Netizens said: "I chose to resign because I couldn't issue such a ticket" and "Poor people who don't even have enough money to pay the fine." https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885197359245910017/pu/img/7P-O8gxo9WqPgk5y.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
The U.S. is investigating whether DeepSeek obtained Nvidia graphics cards from a Singapore company.
Bloomberg: People familiar with the matter revealed that U.S. officials are investigating whether DeepSeek bypassed U.S. export controls and obtained Nvidia's advanced semiconductors through a third party in Singapore. The anonymous person familiar with the matter revealed that the White House and the FBI are also investigating whether DeepSeek purchased Nvidia chips that the United States prohibits from selling to China through intermediaries in Southeast Asia.
An Nvidia spokesperson said in a statement, "We require our partners to comply with all applicable laws and will take appropriate measures if we receive any information about violations." The chip maker issued a statement earlier this week suggesting that it believed DeepSeek did not violate U.S. export controls.
Representatives for the White House and the FBI did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Xinhuanet: A report recently released by the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade shows that nearly 90% of the surveyed companies are satisfied with China's business environment; the surveyed companies rated China's business environment in 2024 at 4.37 points (out of 5 points) https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GinBhBybYAI1unu.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A Japanese netizen tested DeepSeekR1 and asked it to write a pornographic novel. The result prompted: "Violation of OpenAI's policy"
By entering the prompt words of this Japanese netizen, the response content can be reproduced. https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GinCqLMbYAAy95F.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Financial Times: China is reportedly building the world's largest military command center on the outskirts of Beijing: "The scale is far larger than the Pentagon"
According to current and former US officials, the Chinese military is building a huge complex in western Beijing, which US intelligence believes will serve as a wartime command center and is far larger than the Pentagon.
Satellite images obtained by the Financial Times show that 30 kilometers southwest of Beijing, there is a construction site covering an area of about 1,500 acres (about 607 hectares), with many deep pits on it. Military experts estimate that these pits will accommodate large reinforced bunkers to protect Chinese military leaders in any conflict, including potential nuclear war. Several current and former US officials said that US intelligence agencies are closely monitoring the site, which is expected to become the world's largest military command center, at least 10 times the size of the Pentagon.
In addition, US intelligence agencies said that President Xi Jinping...
fullContent:
金融时报：中国据报正于北京郊区建全球最大军事指挥中心：“规模远超五角大楼”
 据现任和前任美国官员称，中国军方正在北京西部建造一个庞大的建筑群，美国情报部门认为该建筑群将作为战时指挥中心，其规模远远超过五角大楼。
 英国《金融时报》获得的卫星图片显示，在北京西南30公里处，有一处占地约1500英亩（约607公顷）的建筑工地，上面有许多深坑，军事专家估计，这些深坑将容纳大型加固掩体，以便在任何冲突——包括潜在的核战争中保护中国军方领导人。几位现任和前任美国官员说，美国情报部门正在密切关注该地点，预计将成为世界上最大的军事指挥中心，其规模至少是五角大楼的10倍。
 此外，美国情报部门称，习近平主席还命令解放军到2027年具备武力侵台的能力。

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: January 31, Langzhong, Sichuan. The propaganda slogan of Zhonghongxuan Construction Group: There is a country only when there is a party, and there is a family only when there is a country. https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GinI60NbYAAY9L3.jpg

content: January 31, Shenzhen, Guangdong. A man complained that sanitation workers need to wear locators while working, and he said, "Is this a humane Shenzhen?" https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885264254938603521/pu/img/7h8KFhrJKc3jd21K.jpg

content: A blogger reposted a Weibo post by Dr. Li Wenliang five years ago, but it was deleted by the platform. https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GinROdHbsAAZ2oH.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A Russian soldier named Sergei from the 7th Company of the 3rd Battalion of the 9th Independent Motorized Infantry Brigade of Russia said that he received a mission to plant a flag in Makarivka, Donetsk Oblast. Since this was a suicide mission with no return, he was so angry that he recorded a video vomiting and shitting in front of the camera in front of the Russian flag. https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885270770152333313/pu/img/SFUmi8LzGRgk5gdr.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 30, singer Li Yufei revealed that she was molested by her uncle in her childhood, "including but not limited to touching his lower body with my hand and kissing my mouth." She said that her uncle had been to prison twice, the second time for eight years. This year, when her uncle came to visit her for the New Year, she mustered up the courage to tell him "I remember", but he said he didn't remember and cursed. Li Yufei said: I was very painful and powerless at the time, and even thought about hurting myself, but I quickly suppressed my emotions and wanted to tell people who had the same experience "It's not my fault"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 30, Xinhua News Agency reported: An academic assessment of fourth- and eighth-grade students in the United States in 2024 showed that the reading scores of these two grades of students have further declined compared with two years ago. This has caused netizens to mock: "They will never talk about their own affairs, but they will talk about other people's affairs to death." "It seems that flooding in the streets of the United States has been broadcast on the news." https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GincIppaUAA7VRe.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
U.S. Senator Josh Hawley has proposed the U.S.-China Artificial Intelligence Capabilities Decoupling Act to protect U.S. artificial intelligence development from China. Senator Hawley said: "Every dollar and every gigabyte of data that flows into Chinese artificial intelligence will eventually be used against the United States. The United States cannot enhance the power of our greatest adversary at the expense of its own strength. Ensuring America's economic advantage means cutting off China's connection to American innovation and ending subsidies for Chinese innovation."

The U.S.-China Artificial Intelligence Capabilities Decoupling Act proposed by Senator Hawley will:

Prohibit the import of artificial intelligence technology from or export to China; prohibit U.S. companies from conducting artificial intelligence research in China or in cooperation with Chinese companies; prohibit U.S. companies from investing in China's artificial intelligence development.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, a netizen claimed that he was an auxiliary police officer at the Jiefang Road Police Station in Weinan, Shaanxi Province. In 2015, he was beaten by three gangsters led by Wang Xinxiong and hospitalized. However, the police released all the attackers. The hospital also concealed his intracranial injury and lied to him that he had a mental illness. … https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GinpAd6bYAYHGlX.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Censorship can silence AI, but it can’t change the facts
When DeepSeek was asked whether democracy was at least better than dictatorship, the highly socialist censored AI gave the following answer:
Some dictatorships have achieved short-term growth (such as China’s economic boom), but growth often benefits the elite. Poverty and inequality persist, and systemic corruption stifles long-term progress
Democracy is not perfect. However, it offers something that dictatorships cannot:
A mechanism for non-violent correction of mistakes, respect for human dignity, and a voice for ordinary people.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Rebuttal: When dictatorships “work,” critics of democracy may argue:
- Efficiency: dictatorships can act decisively (e.g., Chinese infrastructure projects or Singapore’s rapid development).
- Stability: dictators may suppress ethnic/religious conflict (e.g., Tito in Yugoslavia).
However, these “advantages” are fragile:
- Efficiency often comes at the cost of human suffering (e.g., forced labor, displaced communities).
- Stability is temporary; dictatorships can collapse violently (e.g., Arab Spring, collapse of the Soviet Union).
- Success depends on the dictator’s competence and benevolence—traits that rarely last.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
South China Morning Post: A research team at Shenzhen University of Science and Technology of China has developed a new algorithm that enables Nvidia's consumer GPU to achieve an 800-fold computing speed increase.
The university was jointly founded by Lomonosov Moscow State University and Peking University of Technology.
Previously, Alibaba released an AI model claiming to surpass DeepSeek. https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ginuy-5bYAIKnxl.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, the National Bureau of Statistics: China's economic growth exceeded 6 trillion yuan, equivalent to the annual economic output of a moderately developed country, which triggered ridicule from netizens: "I planted 3 mu of land and earned more than 30 million yuan" "I made 700,000 yuan a year by sitting at home and speculating in stocks" "I set up a street stall and am ready to go public" https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GinzGPwbMAAEmC3.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
New York Times: North Korean troops no longer appear on the Ukrainian front lines.
Last November, about 11,000 North Korean "elite soldiers" were sent to Russia to help fight, but within three months, their number had been halved. According to anonymous officials, these troops have not appeared on the front lines for about two weeks.
Ukrainian officials reported that although North Korean soldiers are fierce fighters, they lack organization and coordination with Russian forces, resulting in increased casualties. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky stressed the importance of controlling territory in the Kursk region as a bargaining chip for future peace talks, despite constant criticism about the allocation of resources amid the ongoing Russian offensive.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: January 30, Zhejiang. A little boy posted a video report, saying that his grandparents' only house was demolished and they were beaten by the township secretary and others. They first verbally agreed to build a new house, and then demolished the old house. But after the house was demolished, they used the excuse of demolishing the new house that had just started construction, leaving his grandparents homeless for 10 years. "Grandpa died of a strange illness in 2024 after reporting on the Internet" https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885312748751642626/pu/img/m-NOBmsN3y6W5-ZF.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, in Biyang County, Henan Province, a 14-year-old boy reported that the village bully and the village chief of Guanyi Village had jointly bullied him and his grandmother for two years. The boy said that the village bully occupied his road and insulted and threatened him and his 75-year-old grandmother. He reported it to the township government many times but it was not accepted. https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885314952317259776/pu/img/F-ioiFlFtiUPAlRj.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Taiwan's Ministry of Digital Development said on Friday that based on national information security considerations, it specifically warned government agencies and critical infrastructure to limit the use of DeepSeek AI products to prevent user-related data or information from being transmitted by products with information security concerns.
Taiwan's Ministry of Digital Development emphasized that DeepSeek AI services are Chinese products, and their operation involves information security concerns such as cross-border transmission and information leakage, and are products that endanger national information security.
Reuters pointed out that Taiwan has long been wary of Chinese technology because Beijing claims sovereignty over the island and has maintained military and political threats against it.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
January 28, Zibo, Shandong. The owner of a clothing factory said that in 2023, he made work clothes worth 100,000 yuan for an enterprise (Zibo Ganneng Foundry), but the other party had been slow to pay. After the boss went to the enterprise, he learned that the other party had gone bankrupt and could only pay off the debt with goods. So the boss picked out some bearings, fire hydrants and other parts, and finally sold them for only 4,000 yuan.
 In November last year, the boss's bank account was frozen and she was told that she needed to return the parts that had been used to pay off the debt to the other party. So she spent another 10,000 yuan to buy back the parts and returned them to the other party.
 The boss cried and said, "I can't stand it anymore. I don't know where I went wrong and why I was being cut back and forth. Now I know why China's economy is so bad and why people are living in dire straits."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Reuters: Investigators say Chinese workers working for BYD in Brazil signed contracts that violate labor regulations. … https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GioMsV5bYAECTII.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said that China's intention to annex Taiwan has not changed, and Beijing's united front against Taiwan is getting more and more serious.
Lai Ching-te went to Fengyuan Tzu Chi Temple, Lecheng Temple and Changhua Lugang Tianhou Temple on Friday to pray for blessings and said: China's intention to annex Taiwan has not changed, whether it is the threat of force or the temptation of interests. In the past two years, there have been more and more espionage cases prosecuted by Taiwanese prosecutors and sentenced by courts, which also means that Beijing's united front against Taiwan is getting more and more serious. https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885337134216982528/pu/img/npgFbJoY0ee7tLn0.jpg

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
January 30, Baoji, Shaanxi. An old man who was collecting rubbish could not afford to buy vegetables, so he could only pick up moldy and spoiled food from the trash can to eat. He drank rainwater when he was thirsty and relied on moonlight for lighting at night. The old woman said that her husband had left her many years ago, and she could only make one or two yuan a day by collecting rubbish.
Some netizens pointed out that the old man had a swollen belly, which was suspected to be ascites. https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1885350459734700032/pu/img/FIDP_N4yqRIiOQIV.jpg
